appearances.snippet: thom tillis, senator john kennedy, just to name a few conservatives. >> first of all, if i may respond to van, we are paying with the new east wing of the white white house with private donations, not taxpayer dollars. unlike the fed renovation. but we'll leave that for another day. look, there are practical implications to the president's decision making here or the administration's decision making. i don't know that the president personally had anything to do with it, and that is on the hill. if he wants to replace jerome powell in may with a new fed chair, you're going to have confirmation issues. i mean, that's the first most politically practical problem that you have with this. i would think the second biggest problem is when you interview people for this. whoever you want to pick is going to ask you, are you going to come after me if i displease you? and so you may have trouble attracting the people that you want for the job. so i don't know where this is going. i actually agree with senator thune. if you're going to get into something like this, you better have something, becau

appearances.title: The Exchange : CNBC : January 13, 2026 1:00pm-2:00pm EST
appearances.snippet: you have senators kevin cramer, dave mccormick, john kennedy all telling me and other reporters yesterday that they do not think that powell is guilty, although they have yet to go as far as saying that they will not confirm a fed nominee. another senator, lisa murkowski, has backed tillis on holding off on confirming any nominees until this investigation is over. and many other members of the banking committee i've spoken with tell me that they either need more time to understand the investigation or say the investigation needs to play out. but so far, everyone i've spoken to, none have outright supported this investigation into powell and kelly. i think that is a very interesting break that you're seeing up here among republicans on capitol hill. and president trump. >> remind us what the time frame is, emily, of when we expect this all to begin to start happening, if it is, in fact, going to happen the way that we initially thought, or if now this throws some change of plans into how it will play out. >> well, i think what would of course need to happen is for the next opening to come.

appearances.title: The Presidency Dinner with the President : CSPAN3 : January 4, 2026 9:36am-10:46am EST
appearances.snippet: and the first one i want to start with, as you referred to, the taste of jacqueline and john kennedy. and i want to talk not so much about her, the style that she brought to the white house, but about one particular dinner that just seems to me to be an exercise in risk taking and that is the dinner that they hosted at the most beautiful setting possible down at mt. vernon. this is a wonderful story. and this is the kind of story that got me to write this book. this dinner took place in 1961. the kennedys had just come back from a meeting in versailles outside of paris, where they were fitted at a at a so-called magical dinner out in the woods. and jackie was so taken by this that she wanted to do something similar here. the question was, who would they do it for and where? it turned out that general khan, the president of pakistan, was due for a state visit. he was a very important ally, but he was a tough guy. and he and president kennedy's relationship had soured. so there the stakes were high and she chose to do it at mount vernon, george washington's estate down on the potomac in

appearances.snippet: subcommittee chair john kennedy and ranking member patty murray worked tirelessly on this bill, and theyve my appreciation. mr. president, members ought to have a voice in the funding decisions that affects all of our states and constituents back home. the bills in this package were drafted with input from nearly every senator. together, senators submitted literally thousands of requests to the committee for consideration. in some cases, these were programmatic requests, supporting programs that they know well from their own state's experience. in other cases, they were a community development project request, cds's, and the legislation before us incorporates many of these requests and takes into account viewpoints from across the chamber on both sides of the aisle. it truly is a member-driven product. enacting this package, mr. president, would bring the total number of full-year fiscal year 2026 appropriations signed into law to six, as the first three bills -- the agriculture, military construction and vernes veterans affairs and legislative branch bills -- were enacted in november. m

appearances.snippet: in the western hemisphere, they proceeded from the fact that the american leadership, primarily john kennedywhom we know as, well, a great democrat— he was the one who initiated the bay of pigs— was essentially dissatisfied with the fact that his predecessor, general eisenhower, the president of the united states of america, had not done enough to... well, prevent the communists from coming to power. in cuba, and the subsequent us attack on the dominican republic , the refrain was one: we will not allow another cuba to exist; that was the main goal, so to speak, of the attack on the dominican republic. just a year after the bay of pigs invasion , the cuban missile crisis erupted. also known as the cuban missile crisis, the cuban missile crisis brought the entire world to the brink of disaster, because the americans once again declared their readiness to use nuclear weapons. weapons, by the way, this was the thirty-third warning to the world, that is, the americans warned the world 33 times... that they were ready to use nuclear weapons, therefore, when today the world community begins to loo
